forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy drizzle after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 59. West southwest wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy drizzle before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 66 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a gentle coolness, hinting at the patchy drizzle anticipated later in the night. The horizon, softly cloaked in clouds, reveals glimpses of a transitioning sky—streaks of optimism where the sun has just retreated. With temperatures lingering around 59 degrees, the evening promises a chill that draws onlookers inward, perhaps towards the comfort of a warm brew or an intimate gathering.

Tomorrow morning, the remainings of a light drizzle will barely brush against the waking city, but as the sun makes its appearance, clarity is expected. The forecast hints at warmth, crawling up to about 68, with a fresh breeze that invites one to embrace the outdoors. Those who venture out should dress in layers; a light jacket will provide solace against the subtle bite of wind while allowing for a comfortable exploration as the day unfolds. A stroll through Golden Gate Park or a quiet moment spent at the waterfront could be just the remedy to savor this dynamic interplay of fog and sunshine.
